answers.answer: You had some improvements from August to October.TC from 198 to 187LDL from 131 to 105HDL from 56 to 65FBS from 95 to 104.All of those changes are within a normal deviation from test to test.Except for the LDL drop.What have you changed, if anything,  over those 2 months?Did you begin a statin?  Often a statin can boost a FBS result.I don't think

I didn't get to finish my post...hit the wrong key and it posted before I was done.Anyway,  I don't think the FBS at 104 is good.   Not seriously bad,  but goes under the classification of pre-diabetes in some people's booksHowever you can retest it in future tests to see if that is your norm or was just high for this test.Your other results look fine according to most standards.Do you have a history of higher than normal FBS?

question: hi all. these r my new test results: ldl: 105  fbs: 104 hdl: 65 chol: 187 i am 36 year old , 182 cm and 84 kg. i exercise 3 or 4 times every week and spend about 4000-5000 colory every week and have a tight diet about sweet fat and other unuseful foods. what your idea about test results specially fbs?
